cyclone.name: CRISTOBAL
cyclone.current_location: about 155 mi WSW of Campeche, Mexico
cyclone.trajectory: Meandering in the southern Bay of Campeche through mid-week, then expected to turn northward and track across the central Gulf of Mexico toward the Louisiana coast late this weekend.
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: Louisiana Gulf Coast (likely between Morgan City and the Mississippi River delta)

port.name: Port of Greater Baton Rouge, LA

weather_observation.impacted_coast: Southern Bay of Campeche coast from Campeche to Puerto de Veracruz currently; Gulf coast from Yucatán Peninsula northward likely affected later in the period
weather_observation.rain_fall_above_4_inch: Yes – potential if the center tracks into Louisiana
weather_observation.wind: Chance (3%) of tropical-storm-force gusts late Sunday/Monday; otherwise breezy conditions.
weather_observation.storm_surge: None expected at the port itself; surge limited to immediate Gulf coastline.
weather_observation.rainfall: Heavy tropical downpours possible late weekend into Monday with localized 4–8 inch totals and flash-flood potential.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Possible river flooding and navigation restrictions on the Mississippi River system; heightened debris flow risk from heavy rain.
